      • verifyMap

        public boolean verifyMap()
        This method will return true if the Map is connected, and false otherwise. The way it is implemented is by applying a BREADTH-FIRST search algorithm from the starting cell and then checking if the ending cell has been explored or not. If the ending cell has been explored, then the PATH is valid. This BFS also explores the shortest path from the End Cell to the Start Cell to get rid of Loops. This method also initializes the boolean isMapValid to a T/F value.
        Returns:
        isMapValid If the path on the map connects the start point and the end point, return true; Otherwise, return false.

      • key

        public int key(int i,
               int j)
        To get the key for the verifyMap method.
        Parameters:
        i - An integer as the x axis value.
        j - An integer as the y axis value.
        Returns:
        gridWidth*j+i+1 get the key value.

      • arckeyi

        public int arckeyi(int k)
        The method to get the next x axis value to find a path.
        Parameters:
        k - An integer as the key value.
        Returns:
        ((k-1)%gridWidth The next x value.

      • arckeyj

        public int arckeyj(int k)
        The method to get the next y axis value to find a path.
        Parameters:
        k - An integer as the key value.
        Returns:
        ((k-1)%gridWidth The next y value.
